front.title: Evaluation Test Cases for Interactive Real-Time Media over Wireless Networks

abstract.t: The Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) is a common transport choice for interactive multimedia communication applications. The performance of such applications typically depends on a well- functioning congestion control algorithm. To ensure seamless and robust user experience, a well-designed RTP-based congestion control algorithm should work well across all access network types. This document describes test cases for evaluating performances of such congestion control algorithms over LTE and Wi-Fi networks.
